discussion.content:
The continued business justification principle is one of the seven principles of PRINCE2, a widely-used project management methodology. This principle emphasizes the need for a project to have a clear and ongoing justification for its existence throughout its lifecycle.
Answer B, "The business objectives," is therefore the correct answer. It is important for project managers to regularly review and update the project's business case to ensure that it remains aligned with the organization's objectives. This may involve re-evaluating the project's scope, timeline, and resources to ensure that it continues to deliver value and benefits to the organization.

discussion.content:
The closing a project process is one of the processes in the PRINCE2 methodology, and it represents the final stage of a project. The main purpose of this process is to ensure that the project is completed in a controlled and organized manner and that it delivers its intended benefits.
The correct answer to this question is B. To confirm the project has nothing more to deliver. This means that all the project objectives have been met, all the deliverables have been produced, and all the stakeholders are satisfied with the results. At this point, the project can be formally closed, and the team can be disbanded.

questions.question_text: Which role represents the stakeholders who will operate the project's products after the project is complete?

discussion.content: The Senior User role is critical to the success of a project, as they represent the interests of the end-users who will ultimately be using the project's products or services. They work closely with the Project Manager to ensure that the project's goals align with the users' needs and requirements and are accountable for ensuring that the project's products are delivered on time, within budget, and to the desired quality standards.
